\bigskip

\beginlyrics

%\rmlyrics

\hbox{

\vtop{
\hsize52mm

\verse2. Noctis rec\'olitur c\oe na nov\'\i ssima,\\
Qua Christus cr\'editur agnum et \'azyma\\
Ded\'\i sse fr\'atribus, juxta leg\'\i tima\\
Priscis ind\'ulta p\'atribus.

\verse3. Post agnum t\'ypicum, expl\'etis \'epulis,\\
Corpus Dom\'\i nicum datum disc\'\i pulis,\\
Sic totum \'omnibus, quod totum s\'\i ngulis,\\
Ejus fat\'emur m\'anibus.

\verse4. Dedit frag\'\i libus c\'orporis f\'erculum,\\
Dedit et tr\'\i stibus s\'anguinis p\'oculum,\\
Dicens: Acc\'\i pite quod trado v\'asculum,\\
Omnes ex eo b\'\i bite.


\verse5. Sic sacrif\'\i cium istud inst\'\i tuit,\\
Cujus off\'\i cium comm\'\i tti v\'oluit\\
Solis presb\'yteris, quibus sic c\'ongruit.\\
Ut sumant, et dent c\'eteris.


}

\hskip5mm

\vtop{

\hsize48mm

\itlyrics

\verse2. Now we remember the supper of that last evening,
in which we know that Christ gave the paschal lamb and the unleavened bread
to the brethren,
according to the law of the ancient fathers.

\verse3. After the symbol of the lamb, 
supper being over,
we believe that the Body of the Lord was given to the disciples by His own hands,
whole to all and whole to each one.

\verse4. To the weak He gave His strengthening Body,
to the sad the cup of His Blood,
saying: Receive what I give you, drink ye all of this.

\verse5. So He founded this sacrifice, which He committed to priests alone,
that they should partake and give to the others.


}

}

\bigskip

\hbox{

\vtop{
\hsize52mm

\verse6. Panis ang\'elicus fit panis h\'ominum:\sidx{Panis angelicus}\\
Dat panis c\'\ae licus fig\'uris t\'erminum:\\
O res mir\'abilis! mand\'ucat D\'ominum\\
Pauper, servus, et h\'umilis.

\verse7. Te trina D\'eitas \'unaque p\'oscimus,\\
Sic nos tu v\'\i sita, sicut te c\'olimus:\\
Per tuas s\'emitas duc nos quo t\'endimus,\\
Ad lucem quam inh\'abitas.

Amen.

}
\hskip5mm

\vtop{
\hsize48mm

\itlyrics

\verse6. \idx{The bread of angels} becomes bread of men;
the heavenly food makes an end of symbols.
O wonderful thing, a poor and lowly servant eats the Body of the Lord.

\verse7. We pray Thee, Godhead three and one,
come to us as we worship Thee; lead us by Thy path
to the goal for which we hope, to the light in which Thou dwellest.

Amen.

}
}

\endlyrics

\source St.~Thomas Aquinas, {\smold1227}--\smold74

\source Translated by Adrian Fortescue, {\smold 1874}--{\smold 1923}
